TEXT.English: In Cheat Mode press K to instantly research Technology
[ICON_BULLET]Goods over storage capacity are sold at %d1%% of the price on market
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Les marchandises excédant la capacité de stockage sont vendues à %d1%% de leur prix en market.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Güter jenseits der Lagerkapazitäten werden zu %d1%% des Preises in market verkauft
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]I beni che superano la capienza dei depositi vengono venduti al %d1%% del prezzo in market
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Las mercancías que sobrepasan la capacidad de almacenamiento se venden al %d1%% de su precio en market.

TEXT.English: In Cheat Mode press Alt K to add 500 Trade Points to Player
In Cheat Mode press V for AI autoplay 1 turn, Ctrl V for 25 turns, Alt V for 100, Shift Alt V Max turns before Revolution. Press V again to End Autoplay

Invention is a very creative process. An open and curious mind enables one to see beyond what is known. Inventors think outside of the box. "Hell, there are no rules here we're trying to accomplish something new". -Thomas A. Edison. Seeing a new possibility, a new connection or relationship can spark an invention. Inventive thinking frequently involves combining concepts or elements from different realms that would not normally be put together. Sometimes inventors skip over the boundaries between distinctly separate territories or fields. Ways of thinking, materials, processes or tools from one realm are used as no one else has imagined in a different realm.[NEWLINE][TAB]To invent is to see anew. "To raise new questions, new possibilities, to regard old questions from a new angle, requires creative imagination and marks real advance". -Einstein. Inventors often envision a new idea, seeing it in their mind's eye. New ideas can arise when the conscious mind turns away from the subject or problem; or when the focus is on something else; or even while relaxing or sleeping. A novel idea may come in a flash - a Eureka! moment. For example, after years of working to figure out the general theory of relativity, the solution came to Einstein suddenly in a dream "like a giant die making an indelible impress, a huge map of the universe outlined itself in one clear vision".
We have discovered the Knowledge of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_name[COLOR_REVERT] from living among the Barbarians.
You recieved %d1_amount[ICON_GOLD] for being the first to discover %s2_name.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Must be in Revolution to take effect[COLOR_REVERT]

Explorers represent the many Europeans who set out to discovery new Trade routes or to Map the New World. Such famouse names as, Sir Francis Drake, Ferdinand Magellan, and Henry Hundson come to mind when we think of the great Explorers.

Conquerors represent the many Europeans who set out to find treasure, hidden cities of gold, and to enslave the natives of the New World. Such famouse names as, Hernan Cortes and Ponce de Leon come to mind when we think of the great Conquerors.

In 1499 Alonso de Ojeda left Puerto de Santa Maria to explore the coast of Venezuela. With Ojeda was Amerigo Vespucci, a Florentine diplomat, scholar, and businessman who had played a major part in the organization of Columbus's second expedition. Vespucci participated in numerous voyages of Brazil, but his role seems to have been more that of an interested observer than a leader. His fame derives mainly from the fact that he realized the significance of what he saw of South America, and when re returned to Spain in 1500 he announced that the land in the Southern Hemisphere was not part of Asia, as Columbus still believed, but a New World.
This is where Inventors live and work. New Ideas are created here and they can change the course of History.

Throughout history there have been those that had a profound influence on the current state of man's Intellegence and Knowlege of what is and what could be. These persons where Prolific thinkers that decided in there own mind that what is could be something else and regardless of what was thought as heresy they chose to persue such ideas. Thus we have invention.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Made available by aquireing the Trading Perk[COLOR_REVERT] [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_Name[COLOR_REVERT]
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Can build a home in a settlement[COLOR_REVERT]
We have converted %d1_num %s2_name to %s3_toname through the discovery of %s4_tech

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Idustrial Victory[COLOR_REVERT] can be attempted by all Colonys. You must be the first to Sell [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%d1_units[COLOR_REVERT] units of %F2 at the docks in Europe.[NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Cloth can no longer be purchased in Europe[COLOR_REVERT]

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Cottons Mills[COLOR_REVERT] are the ultimate sources of cloth, useing the power of steam they transform six [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cotton[COLOR_REVERT] into twelve [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cloth[COLOR_REVERT] (when worked by a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Free Colonist[COLOR_REVERT]). By assigning a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Weaver[COLOR_REVERT] to work in your [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textile Mill[COLOR_REVERT], that number can be increased even further! You must construct a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Steamworks[COLOR_REVERT] before you can construct this building. If you are attempting an [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Industrial Victory[COLOR_REVERT] then these buildings are your key to winning.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usines textiles[COLOR_REVERT] sont les plus importants sites de production de tissu, capables de transformer six unités de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coton[COLOR_REVERT] en neuf unités de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tissu[COLOR_REVERT] (lorsqu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Colon libre[COLOR_REVERT] y est assigné). En employant un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maître tisserand[COLOR_REVERT] dans votre [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine textile[COLOR_REVERT], votre capacité de production sera encore augmentée ! Vous devez d'abord faire bâtir une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]scierie[COLOR_REVERT] avant de pouvoir ordonner la construction de ce bâtiment.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textilfabriken[COLOR_REVERT] sind die besten Produktionsstätten für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stoff[COLOR_REVERT]. Sie verarbeiten sechs Einheiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Baumwolle[COLOR_REVERT] zu neun Einheiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stoff[COLOR_REVERT], wenn dort ein [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Freier Kolonist[COLOR_REVERT] arbeitet. Indem Sie einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Meisterweber[COLOR_REVERT] anweisen, in Ihrer [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textilfabrik[COLOR_REVERT] zu arbeiten, steigern Sie die Menge zusätzlich! Sie müssen ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sägewerk[COLOR_REVERT] bauen, bevor Sie dieses Gebäude errichten können.
TEXT.Italian: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabbriche tessili[COLOR_REVERT] sono la fonte definitiva di tessuto, in grado di trasformare sei unità di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cotone[COLOR_REVERT] in nove di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tessuto[COLOR_REVERT] (quando ci lavora un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]libero colono[COLOR_REVERT]). Mandando un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]mastro tessitore[COLOR_REVERT] a lavorare in una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabbrica tessile[COLOR_REVERT], puoi ulteriormente aumentare la produzione! Prima di poter costruire questo edificio devi costruire una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]segheria[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taller textil[COLOR_REVERT] es la fuente definitiva de Tejido, pues transforma seis unidades de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Algodón[COLOR_REVERT] en nueve de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tejido[COLOR_REVERT] (cuando trabaja en él un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Colono libre[COLOR_REVERT]). Al poner a un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maestro tejedor[COLOR_REVERT] a trabajar en el [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taller textil[COLOR_REVERT], esa cantidad se puede aumentar todavía más. Debéis construir un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Aserradero[COLOR_REVERT] para poder levantar este edificio.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textile Outlets[COLOR_REVERT] are a good sources of cloth, transforming six [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cotton[COLOR_REVERT] into nine [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cloth[COLOR_REVERT] (when worked by a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Free Colonist[COLOR_REVERT]). By assigning a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Master Weaver[COLOR_REVERT] to work in your [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textile Mill[COLOR_REVERT], that number can be increased even further! You must construct a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Lumber Mill[COLOR_REVERT] before you can construct this building.
TEXT.French: Les [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usines textiles[COLOR_REVERT] sont les plus importants sites de production de tissu, capables de transformer six unités de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coton[COLOR_REVERT] en neuf unités de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tissu[COLOR_REVERT] (lorsqu'un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Colon libre[COLOR_REVERT] y est assigné). En employant un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maître tisserand[COLOR_REVERT] dans votre [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Usine textile[COLOR_REVERT], votre capacité de production sera encore augmentée ! Vous devez d'abord faire bâtir une [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]scierie[COLOR_REVERT] avant de pouvoir ordonner la construction de ce bâtiment.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Textilfabriken[COLOR_REVERT] sind die besten Produktionsstätten für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stoff[COLOR_REVERT]. Sie verarbeiten sechs Einheiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Baumwolle[COLOR_REVERT] zu neun Einheiten [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stoff[COLOR_REVERT], wenn dort ein [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Freier Kolonist[COLOR_REVERT] arbeitet. Sie müssen ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sägewerk[COLOR_REVERT] bauen, bevor Sie dieses Gebäude errichten können.
TEXT.Italian: Le [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabbriche tessili[COLOR_REVERT] sono la fonte definitiva di tessuto, in grado di trasformare sei unità di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cotone[COLOR_REVERT] in nove di [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]tessuto[COLOR_REVERT] (quando ci lavora un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]libero colono[COLOR_REVERT]). Mandando un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]mastro tessitore[COLOR_REVERT] a lavorare in una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]fabbrica tessile[COLOR_REVERT], puoi ulteriormente aumentare la produzione! Prima di poter costruire questo edificio devi costruire una [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]segheria[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Taller textil[COLOR_REVERT] es la fuente definitiva de Tejido, pues transforma seis unidades de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Algodón[COLOR_REVERT] en nueve de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tejido[COLOR_REVERT] (cuando trabaja en él un [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Colono libre[COLOR_REVERT]). TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Colonist adapt to the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Colonial[COLOR_REVERT] way of life

Sailors returning from Peru to Spain with silver presumably brought maize and potatoes for their own food on the trip. Historians speculate that leftover tubers (and maize) was carried ashore and planted. Basque fishermen from Spain used potatoes as ships stores for their voyages across Atlantic in the 15th century, and introduced the tuber to western Ireland, where they landed to dry their cod. In 1553, in the book Cronica del Peru Pedro Cieza de Leon mention, that saw it in Quito, Popayan and Pasto. In 1580, English adventurer Francis Drake introduced potatoes into England along with his other Spanish booty when he returned from his notable circumnavigation of the globe. In 1588 botanist Carolus Clusius made a painting of what he called "Papas Peruanorum" from a specimen in Belgium; in 1601 he reported that potatoes were in common use in northern Italy for animal fodder and for human consumption.

In the 13th century, the Crusaders frequently suffered from scurvy. In the 1497 expedition of Vasco de Gama, the curative effects of citrus fruit were known. In 1536, the French explorer Jacques Cartier, exploring the St. Lawrence River, used the local natives' knowledge to save his men who were dying of scurvy. He boiled the needles of the arbor vitae tree (Eastern White Cedar) to make a tea that was later shown to contain 50 mg of vitamin C per 100 grams. Such treatments were not available aboard ship, where the disease was most common. The British civilian medical profession of 1614 believed that it was the acidic principle of citrus fruit which was lacking, although they considered any acid acceptable when ascorbic acid (Vitamin C) was unavailable. In 1614 John Woodall, Surgeon General of the East India Company, published "The Surgion's Mate" as a handbook for apprentice surgeons aboard the company's ships. In it he described scurvy as resulting from a dietary deficiency. His recommendation for its cure was fresh food or, if not available, oranges, lemons, limes and tamarinds, or as a last resort, Oil of Vitriol (sulfuric acid).

Europeans and later Free Colonists are the natural state of any member of your colony. Any citizen of your settlements, when assigned to the Colonist profession, will leave any profession they have adopted and exit onto the main game map.
TEXT.French: Les membres de votre colonie sont par défaut des Colons libres. Tout citoyen de votre colonie, lorsqu'il est assigné à la profession de Colon, abandonnera la profession qu'il exerçait précédemment et se retrouvera sur la carte principale du jeu.
TEXT.German: Freie Kolonisten sind die normalen Mitglieder Ihrer Kolonie. Jeder Bürger Ihrer Siedlungen wird zu einem Freien Kolonisten und begibt sich auf die zentrale Spielkarte, wenn er dem Kolonistenberuf zugewiesen wird.
TEXT.Italian: Lo stato naturale di ogni membro della tua colonia è quello di libero colono. Qualsiasi cittadino dei tuoi insediamenti, quando gli viene assegnata la professione di colono, abbandona quella che aveva fino a poco prima e va alla mappa principale di gioco.
TEXT.Spanish: El de los Colonos libres es el estado natural de cualquier miembro de vuestra colonia. Cuando se le asigna la profesión de Colono a cualquier ciudadano de vuestros asentamientos, dejará la profesión que tenga y saldrá al mapa principal del juego.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Requires a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s1_name[COLOR_REVERT] to be assisting on the Project

[TAB]An observatory is a building designed to allow those inside to study the stars, usually with the aid of a telescope. Early observatories consisted of buildings with conveniently-placed windows or high platforms, while later models have sophisticated rotating roofs with an aperture to hold a massive telescope. The rooftop rotates to allow the telescope to point in any direction. [PARAGRAPH:1]An observatory's location has much to do with its efficacy. Smog and other pollutants cut down on visibility; further, stars become more difficult to observe when there are other light-sources visible; so modern observatories are usually built as far away from cities as practical.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un observatoire est un édifice conçu pour permettre à ses occupants d'y étudier les étoiles, généralement à l'aide d'un télescope. Les premiers observatoires étaient des bâtiments disposant de fenêtres correctement positionnées ou de plates-formes surélevées, tandis que les modèles récents disposent de toits rotatifs sophistiqués avec une ouverture pour placer un immense télescope. Le toit pivote afin de permettre au télescope d'être orienté dans toutes les directions possibles. [PARAGRAPH:1]L'efficacité d'un observatoire dépend largement de son emplacement. Le smog et autres polluants réduisent la visibilité. Par ailleurs, les étoiles sont plus difficiles à observer lorsque d'autres sources de lumière se trouvent à proximité du lieu d'observation. De ce fait, les observatoires modernes sont généralement construits aussi loin que possible des villes.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Observatorium dient der Beobachtung der Sterne mithilfe von Teleskopen. Die frühen Observatorien waren Bauten mit entsprechend positionierten Fenstern oder hohen Plattformen. Moderne Observatorien sind mit schwenkbaren Dächern und fest montierten Teleskopen ausgestattet. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Standort eines Observatoriums hat großen Einfluss auf dessen Effektivität. Rauch und andere Abgase schränken die Sicht ein. Außerdem sind die Sterne schwerer zu erkennen, wenn andere Lichtquellen zu sehen sind. Daher werden moderne Observatorien nicht in der Nähe von Städten errichtet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'osservatorio è un edificio pensato per consentire lo studio delle stelle, in genere con l'aiuto di un telescopio. I primi osservatori erano edifici dotati di soffittature a vetri e grandi pedane; quelli odierni invece, hanno un tetto girevole con un'apertura nel centro per ospitare un grande telescopio e consentire di osservare in qualsiasi direzione. [PARAGRAPH:1]L'ubicazione di un osservatorio è direttamente proporzionale alla sua efficacia. Lo smog e altri inquinanti riducono la visibilità e, inoltre, le stelle diventano più difficili da osservare quando ci sono altre sorgenti di luce vicine. Per questo motivo, la maggior parte degli osservatori di oggi sono costruiti lontani dalle città.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un observatorio es un edificio diseñado para permitir el estudio de las estrellas, normalmente con la ayuda de un telescopio. Los primeros observatorios eran edificios con ventanas bien situadas o plataformas elevadas, mientras que los más modernos cuentan con sofisticados tejados giratorios con una abertura que aloja un enorme telescopio. El tejado gira para permitir que el telescopio apunte en cualquier dirección. [PARAGRAPH:1]La eficacia de un observatorio está muy relacionada con su emplazamiento. La contaminación reduce la visibilidad; además, las estrellas son más difíciles de observar cuando hay otras fuentes de iluminación próximas, así que los observatorios modernos suelen construirse tan lejos de los centros urbanos como es posible.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatory[COLOR_REVERT] increases a Colonys's research. It is required to build a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratory[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.French: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]observatoire[COLOR_REVERT] améliore la recherche scientifique d'une ville. Il est nécessaire pour construire un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]laboratoire[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.German: Das [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorium[COLOR_REVERT] beschleunigt die wissenschaftliche Forschung einer Stadt. Darüber hinaus ist es die Voraussetzung für den Bau eines [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Labors[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Italian: L'[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]osservatorio[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la ricerca scientifica della città. È richiesto per la costruzione del [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]laboratorio[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Spanish: El [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatorio[COLOR_REVERT] aumenta la investigación científica de la ciudad. Es necesario para construir un [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratorio[COLOR_REVERT].
